name: saint
text: getting there first is the only option, really.

name: geysershitdick
text: Please lord have mercy on this one man's soul

name: katal
text: As much as I have wanted to, I've never been able to try the Ray's technique in the last panel myself.

name: delzhand
text: I want to be brave enough to try this sometime, as well.

name: riazm
text: I suspect they just wouldn't deliver your order, it's not really worth the gamble of losing.

name: ferdinand
text: i had to break up a fight when i tried it.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i chubby you in trust this is true

name: jimbob
text:
I'm in Fast Food Delivery myself. Had to break up a fight just last week.
It's all in a day's work, really. *snff*

name: epicurus
text: I love this so much. The last panel gets this a five, but I also just noticed that Ray is standing on a little bucket in order to see what the others are doing, which is just SO good.

name: jimbob
text: This is the consummate achewood strip.

name: biddlebubbly
text: Honestly in 2004 going Pentium 4 over Athlon 64 was a poor choice.

name: gormster
text: And an 800MHz FSB for a gig of RAM? Talk about overkill.

name: tellumo
text: And then it'll turn out Ray didn't call the Kama Sushi guy after all; he just wanted the Ozuma guy to get there faster.

name: tttt
text: A comment left by tttt was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, Dovey, DorothyPoopBot)

name: stuart
text: Because of this, I no longer see the disjoint just as a logical pause in Ray's dialogue anymore. Nice work.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i always figured that's what the guy said, but the moments of silence idea is so much better.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
no, it's not.
shut it up, me.

name: audhumla
text: This is like two strips in one; it is fantastic.

name: skiddyfisk
text: Exactly. Plop some kind of Beefspeak punchline on the top 4, then run the bottom 3 the next day. Flows perfectly. Brilliant!

name: inordinate
text: Forgive my possible ignorance, but is this the debut of the chubby ?

name: stuart
text:
Thousands of years ago, a caveman comes home from a hard day using dinosaurs to move rocks around. His redhead wife greets him slightly late, having just come out of the shower with no time to throw on a towel.

[i]This[/] is the debut of the chubby.

name: yingkaixing
text: Redhead? Oh, necessarily .

name: heccibiggs
text: Holla.

name: snowman
text: Word.

name: goro
text:
Triple truth, roo.

Man, it sure is easy to get posting here when you're high/drunk.

name: wite_rabit
text: What I'd do for a redhead...

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
they really aren't all that...
well, no, that is a lie.

name: troy_convers
text: Was he sporting a flintstone?

name: fattypneumonia
text: Caveman pushes his wife back against the pillows. He pulls her close and breathes her in. Her scent is delicious. He asks her to have his retarded baby.

name: c4keman
text: This strip doesn't have a high enough rating.

name: biznart
text: For the third time in three days, my vote has changed a score.  I have never felt so important.

name: greenkoolayd
text: easy, tiger.  with great power comes great responsibility.

name: usversusthem
text: Man I wish Photoshop opened in under four seconds in real life.

name: snowman
text: all barely enough time to read seetha narayanan

name: trevor328
text: Chubby for almost spelling that name right.

name: rykan
text:
Used to be my computer was so rubbish I could read all the names.

All the names.

name: capslock_annliv
text: I would lame you for the misspelling but I can't. It's Seetharaman Naranayan, bro. That name haunts my dreams .

name: nonemorenegative
text: I built a hefty new machine in January for throwing around hi-res photo files - PS launches in about 3.5 seconds; I thought of Beef the first time I loaded it up :)

name: aramkolesar
text: This is exactly how Ayn Rand orders food.

name: edgy
text: teodor's magic screen's ratio changes at will. dang dogg this screen is chubby .

name: puguglypress
text: This was the first Achewood strip I ever read...

name: diggidy
text:
"Look at them, wastin' time playin' on the computer!"
Ray says to his single shoe, as he peers angrily through the window of a random household.
